game_description: Welcome to a new category of leisure experience. Completion is a platform for 10-minute visual journeys to help neurodivergent children with calm and concentration. Created by some of the world's best visual artists and musicians, Completion takes you through a range of beautiful sensory experiences that are helpful for challenges related to stress and anxiety. For more information about the effects of Completion, and to get full access, visit completion.one *Note that the files are too large to stream on most connections, so you have to download them to get a proper experience.
review_1: They really want to charge for these things. Like every single fractal VR experience I've tried is behind a paywall. What's up with that? I think the video quality is good here, in any event.
review_2: If you've seen Trey Ratcliff's "Machine Elf" series of VR videos in the TRIPP app or on YouTube, this app contains something similar. To the best of my knowledge, Ratcliff pioneered these types of trippy videos--but to be honest, I kind of like these better. The biggest differentiator is the music--and I just like the music in these better. This app currently has 3 "full" videos (~10 minutes each) and 1 extra that you can purchase as DLC. I have no idea if the app will evolve into something more commercial, but the free content here is actually really decent. The DLC is ~$10 USD for an additional video. You can either stream or download the free content. The download size of each video is ~6gb so maybe try streaming first and grab it if you want it in higher-fidelity.
review_3: Love it. Unity video is my favorite. Though I am very sensitive to motion sickness, this video does not trigger it
